content:
The "Community Development Financial Institutions Fund Amendments Act of 1998" includes technical corrections and amendments to programs administered by the Fund within the Treasury Department. It also extends authorization and makes amendments to the Small Business Capital Enhancement Program. The "Community Development Financial Institutions Fund Amendments Act of 1998" aims to create a fund to support economic revitalization and community development through investment in community development financial institutions. It also provides incentives for insured depository institutions to increase lending and investment in distressed communities. The "Community Development Financial Institutions Fund Amendments Act of 1998" establishes a fund within the Treasury Department to support economic revitalization and community development through community development financial institutions. The Act also incentivizes insured depository institutions to increase lending and investment in distressed communities. The "Community Development Financial Institutions Fund Amendments Act of 1998" establishes a fund within the Treasury Department to support economic revitalization and community development through community development financial institutions. The Fund, a wholly owned government corporation, shall have specified functions and be located in Washington, D.C. It shall not be affiliated with any other federal agency. The Secretary of the Treasury has authority over the management of the Fund. The functions of the Fund are under the supervision of the Secretary of the Treasury, who can appoint officers and employees as necessary. An Inspector General position is also established. The Inspector General position is established under SEC. 118. The Inspector General of the Department of the Treasury is designated as the Inspector General of the Fund. Amendments are made to the Inspector General Act of 1978 and the Community Development Banking and Financial Institutions Act of 1994 for technical corrections. The Secretary of the Treasury may issue regulations and procedures to implement this subtitle. SEC. 3. AMENDMENTS TO PROGRAMS ADMINISTERED BY THE FUND. Amendments to the Community Development Financial Institutions Program include providing assistance through cooperative agreements or contracts and offering training programs through grants, contracts, or cooperative agreements with organizations specializing in community development. Amendments to the Bank Enterprise Act Awards Program include changes to provide assistance to community development financial institutions and low- and moderate-income persons. Amendments to the Bank Enterprise Act Awards Program involve increasing award amounts for certain activities and awarding credit for additional qualified activities. Amendments to the Bank Enterprise Act include expanding forms of assistance deemed appropriate by the Board and evaluating technical assistance provided. Additionally, alternative criteria are established for defining distressed communities. Amendments to the Bank Enterprise Act include expanding forms of assistance and evaluating technical assistance. Section 233(b)(4)(C) is amended to include "alternative" eligibility requirements for distressed communities. Extension of authorization for funds to the Fund under the Community Development Banking and Financial Institutions Act of 1994. Amendments to the Small Business Capital Enhancement Program are also made. (a) Definition of Financial Institution.--Section 252(5) of the Riegle Community Development and Regulatory Improvement Act of 1994 is amended to include community development financial institutions. 
(b) Elimination of Threshold Appropriation.--Section 253 is amended by removing subsection (d) and renumbering subsection (e) as subsection (d). 
(c) Conforming Amendment.--Section 254(a) is amended to include "(if any)" after "appropriate Federal banking agency". 
(d) Amendments to Reimbursement Authority.--Section 257(a) is amended. The Fund will reimburse participating States based on established criteria, including the creation or expansion of programs, need for reimbursement, and availability of resources. Within 30 days of receiving a compliant report, the Fund will reimburse a State meeting the criteria with up to 50% of contributions to reserve funds. This reimbursement will continue until the Fund's allocated funds are exhausted. The Riegle Community Development and Regulatory Improvement Act of 1994 is repealed.
